learningIntentions.text: Develops questions or hypotheses to be investigated scientifically
Identifies the independent, dependent and control variables.
Conducts the experiment while abiding by safety procedures.
Collects and records results accurately and reliably.
Interprets results by constructing a table and/or graph.
Evaluates the reliability and accuracy of the collected results.
Identifies solutions to improve the accuracy and reliability of results.
Analyses the validity of second-hand sources used.
Communicates their findings in a complete scientific report (including Aim, Hypothesis, Method, Results, Conclusion and Reference List).
